text: I am not happy with my purchase at all. I ordered a Gucci tote bag and then found out it was the wrong item. There was no option to cancel it. This is very unfair to me for the fact I made an accident on the purchase and this was my first time on this website. I just really want the bag intended to order :((()() C Herrera
title: I am not happy with my purchase at all

author: customer
text: The whole ordering and shipping process was seamless—that was fine. My only issue was the product was listed as “excellent” condition which is defined by the site as—“Items are clearly unused, but tags are not attached and boxes or dust bags are not included.” This was not the case as my item had clearly been used with some small scuff marks, stains on the zipper, and two corners of the bag flap were worn/torn. This item should have been listed as “very good” condition which is defined as “ Items show minor signs of wear. Shoes may show wear such as light scuffing at the soles, insoles and heels. Handbags and accessories may show wear such as lightly worn corners, light scratches and interior wear.” TRR needs to abide by their definitions otherwise they risk losing credibility in guaranteeing the authenticity and condition of the goods they resell.
title: Item condition not as listed

author: customer
text: The dress is exactly like in the pictures, it arrived after three day I ordered it. The only problem was that it is fits bigger than you'd expect from a size small.

author: customer
text: I bought 5 items new with tags in pristine condition allegedly. 4 were ok but had an old clothes warehouse smell, the 5th was a Veronica Beard blouse, this one had a hole on the seem in the side of the blouse and of course I didn't see it until I had removed the tags. Overall, I guess you get what you pay for. Pristine, well not so much...and I don't trust their "review" process anymore.
title: I bought 5 items new with tags in…

author: customer
text: Advertised a pair of shoes as a size US10, to my surprised they arrived as an IT40 which is US9. Tried to return them for refund and I was told it would not be possible by a very rude and poor English speaking associate. Was not even remotely helpful. Why would I go by a European size chart when I live in Canada and shopping on a US site, with shoes advertised in a US size. NEVER again.
title: Misleading advertising

author: je-belle
text: I purchased a Prada bag that was listed as "excellent - no visible signs of wear". The bag have VISIBLE signs of wear that I noticed right away when I took it out.  The FRONT of the bag have a very visible area where the leather is peeling off. The first thing that came to my mind was to question the authenticity of the bag. Each side of the strap attached to the bag have seams coming off that is very VISIBLE.  There was discoloration in between the bag's flap. I am very upset for the amount of $ I spent in what looks like a fake bag. Unfortunately, it was sold as not returnable.
